high.name: Ghost
alliesSecretText: This card refers to the revenant Sir Godfrey Gwilym (chapter 7, area Q37). Although initially unwilling to accompany the characters, he will do so if the characters convince him that the honor of the Order of the Silver Dragon can be restored with his help. Doing this requires a successful DC 15 Charisma (Persuasion) check.

This card refers to Sir Klutz the phantom warrior (chapter 4, area K84, crypt 33). If Sir Klutz is Strahd's enemy, then the phantom warrior disappears not after seven days, but only after he or Strahd is reduced to 0 hit points.
alliesText: I see a fallen paladin of the fallen order of knights. He lingers like a ghost in a dead dragon's lair.
Stir the spirit of the clumsy knight whose crypt lies deep within the castle.
high.strahdSecretText: Strahd faces the characters in the tomb of King Barov and Queen Ravenovia (area K88).

high.name: Innocent
alliesSecretText: This card refers to Parriwimple (see chapter 3, area E1). Although he's a simpleton, he won't travel to Castle Ravenloft without good cause. Characters can manipulate him into going by preying on his good heart. For instance, he might go there to help rescue missing Barovians, or to save the life of Ireena Kolyana, who is very beautiful. The characters must somehow deal with Bildrath, Parriwimple's employer, who won't let the foolish boy go to the castle for any reason.

This card refers to Ireena Kolyana (chapter 3, area E4). Her brother Ismark, opposes the idea of Ireena's being taken to Castle Ravenloft, but he insists on going there once the characters tell her about the card reading. Ireena won't accompany the characters however, until Kolyan Indirovich's body is laid to rest in the cemetery.
alliesText: I see a young man with a kind heart. A mother's boy! He is strong in body but weak of mind. Seek him out in the village of Barovia.
Evil's bride is the one you seek!
high.strahdSecretText: Strahd faces the characters in Sergei's tomb (area K85).
high.strahdText: He dwells with the one whose blood sealed his doom, a brother of light snuffed out too soon.

high.name: Marionette
alliesSecretText: This card refers to Pidlwick II (chapter 4, area K59 & appendix D)

This card refers to Cloven Belview (chapter 8, area S17), the two-headed mongrelfolk. Clovin serves the Abbot out of fear and perverse sense of loyalty. His job is to deliver food to the other mongrelfolk, whom he abhors. If abbot still lives, Clovin doesn't want to earn the master's ire by attempting to leave, and he refuses to accompany the characters. But if the Abbot dies, Clovin doesn't have any reason to remain in the abbey, so he's willing to come along if he is bribed with wine. Clovin provides no benefit to the party without his Viol.
alliesText: What horror is this? I see a man made by a man. Ageless and alone, it haunts the towers of the castle.
Look for a man of music, a man with two heads. He lives in a place of great hunger and sorrow.
high.strahdSecretText: Strahd faces the characters in the north tower peak (area K60).
high.strahdText: Look to great heights. Find the beating heart of the castle. He waits nearby.

high.name: Darklord
alliesSecretText: There is no NPC who can inspire the characters.
alliesText: Ah, the worst of all "truths": You must face the evil of this land alone!
high.strahdSecretText: Strahd faces the characters in his tomb (area K86).
high.strahdText: He lurks in the depths of darkness, in the one place to which he must return.

high.name: Mists
alliesSecretText: This card refers to Ezmerelda d'Avenir (appendix D). She can be found in the Abbey of Saint Markovia (see chapter 8, area S19) as well as several other locations throughout Barovia.
alliesText: A vistana wanders this land alone, searching for her mentor. She does not stay in one place for long. Seek her out at Saint Markovia's abbey, near the mists.
high.strahdSecretText: This card offers no clue about where the final showdown with Strahd will occur. It can happen anywhere you like in Castle Ravenloft. Alternatively, Madam Eva tells the characters to return to her after at least three days, and she will consult the cards again for them, but only to discern the location of their enemy.
high.strahdText: The cards can't see where the evil lurks. The mists obscure all.

high.name: Executioner
alliesSecretText: This card refers to Ismark Kolyanovich (chapter 3, area E2). Ismark won't accompany the characters to Castle Ravenloft until he knows that his sister, Ireena Kolyana, is safe
alliesText: Seek out the brother of the devil's bride. They call him "the lesser," but he has a powerful soul
high.strahdSecretText: Strahd faces the characters at the overlook (area K6).
high.strahdText: I see a dark figure on a balcony, looking down upon this tortured land with a twisted smile.

high.name: Broken One
alliesSecretText: This card refers to the Mad Mage of Mount Baratok (chapter 2, area M).
This card refers to Donavich, the priest in the village of Barovia (chapter 3, area E5). He will not accompany the characters until his son Doru, is dead and buried.
alliesText: Your greatest ally will be a wizard. His mind is broken, but his spells are strong.
I see a man of faith whose sanity hangs by a thread. He has lost someone close to him.
high.strahdSecretText: Strahd faces the characters in Sergei's tomb (area K86).
high.strahdText: He haunts the tomb of the man he envied above all.

high.name: Tempter
alliesSecretText: This card refers to Arabelle (chapter 2, area L). She gladly joins the party. But if she returns to her camp (chapter 5, area N9), her father Luvash, refuses to let her leave.
This card refers to Vasilka, the flesh golem (chapter 8, area S13).
alliesText: I see a child - a Vistana. You must hurry, for her fate hangs in the balance. Find her at the lake!
I hear a wedding bell, or perhaps a death knell. It calls the to a mountainside abbey, wherein you will find a woman who is more than the sum of her parts.
high.strahdSecretText: Strahd confronts the characters in the treasury (area K41). "A woman of great beauty" refers to the portrait of Tatyana hanging in the castle's study (area K37), which contains a secret door that leads to the treasury.
high.strahdText: I see a secret place - a vault of temptation hidden behind a woman of great beauty. The evil waits atop his tower of treasure.

high.name: Beast
alliesSecretText: This card refers to the werewolf Zuleika Toranescu (chapter 15, area Z7). She will accompany the characters if they promise to avenge her mate, Emil, by killing the leader of her pack, Kiril Stoyanovich.
alliesText: A werewolf holds a secret hatred for your enemy. Use her hatred to your advantage.
high.strahdSecretText: Strahd faces the characters in the audience hall (area K25).
high.strahdText: The beast sits on his dark throne.

high.name: Donjon
alliesSecretText: This card refers to Victor Vallakovich (chapter 5, area N3t). Realizing that the characters are the key to his salvation, he enthusiastically leaves home and accompanies them to Castle Ravenloft.

This card refers to Stella Wachter (chapter 5, area N4n). She grants the party no benefit unless her madness is cured. With her wits restored, Stella is happy to join the party and leave her rotten family behind.
alliesText: Search for a troubled young man surrounded by wealth and madness. His home is his prison
Find a girl driven to insanity, locked in the heart of her dead father's house. Curing her madness is key to your success.
high.strahdSecretText: Strahd faces the characters in the hall of bones (area K67).
high.strahdText: He lurks in a hall of bones, in the dark pits of his castle.

high.name: Raven
alliesSecretText: This card refers to Davian Martikov (chapter 12, "The Wizard of the Wines"). The old wereraven, realizing that he has a chance to end Strahd's tyranny, leaves his vineyard and winery in the capable hands of his sons, Adrian and Elvir. But before he travels to Castle Ravenloft to face Strahd, Davian insists on reconciling with his third son, Urwin Martikov (chapter 5, area N2).
alliesText: Find the leader of the feathered ones who live among the vines. Though old, he has one more fight left in him.
high.strahdSecretText: Strahd faces the characters in the tomb of King Barov and Queen Ravenovia (area K88).

high.name: Seer
alliesSecretText: This card refers to Kasimir Velikov (chapter 5, area N9a). The dusk elf accompanies the characters to Castle Ravenloft only after they lead him to the Amber Temple and find the means to resurrect his dead sister, Patrina Velikovna.
alliesText: Look for a dusk elf living among the Vistani. He has suffered a great loss and is haunted by dark dreams. Help him, and he will help you in return.
high.strahdSecretText: Strahd faces the characters in the study (area K37).
high.strahdText: He waits for you in a place of wisdom, warmth, and despair. Great secrets are there.

high.name: Artifact
alliesSecretText:
This card refers to Rictavio (appendix D), who can be found at the Blue Water Inn, in Vallaki (chapter 5, area N2). Normally reluctant to accompany the characters, Rictavio changes his tune if the characters tell him about the card reading. He sheds his disguise and introduces himself as Dr. Rudolf van Richten.

The characters might think that Gadof Blinsky, the toymaker of Vallaki (area N7), is the figure they seek, because he has a pet monkey. If the speak to him about the possibility, Blinsky jokes that he and the monkey are "old friends," but if the characters ask him to come with them to fight Strahd, he politely declines. If the characters tell him about the tarokka reading, Blinsky admits that he acquired the monkey from a half-elf carnival ringmaster named Rictavio.
alliesText: Look for an entertaining man with a monkey. This man is more than he seems.
high.strahdSecretText: Strahd faces the characters in the chapel (area K15).
high.strahdText: He lurks in the darkness where the morning light once shone - a sacred place.

high.name: Horseman
alliesSecretText:
This card refers to Nikolai Wachter the elder, who is dead (chapter 5, area N4o). If the characters cast a raise dead spell or a resurrection spell on his preserved corpse, Nikokai (LN male human noble) agrees to help the characters once he feels well enough, despite his wife's protests. Although his family has long supported Strahd, Nikolai came to realize toward the end of his life that Strahd must be destroyed to save Barovia.

If the characters don't have the means to raise Nikolai from the dead, Rictavio (appendix D) gives them a spell scroll of raise dead if he learns of their need. If they're staying at the Blue Water Inn, he leaves the scroll in one of their rooms.

This card refers to the Vistani assassin Arrigal (chapter 5, area N9c). If the characters mention this card reading to him he accepts his fate and accompanies them. If the characters succeed in defeating Strahd, Arrigal betrays and attacks them, believing that he is destined to become Barovia's new lord.
alliesText: I see a dead man of noble birth, guarded by his widow. Return to life the dead man's corpse, and he will be your staunch ally.
A man of death named Arrigal will forsake his dark lord to serve your cause. Beware! He has a rotten soul.
high.strahdSecretText: Strahd faces the characters in his tomb (area K86).
high.strahdText: He lurks in the one place to which he must return - a place of death.

low.name: Swashbuckler
low.secretText: The treasure lies in the crypt of Endorovich (chapter4, area K84, crypt 7).
low.text: I see the skeleton of a deadly warrior, lying on a bed of stone flanked by gargoyles.

low.name: Philanthropist
low.secretText: The treasure is in the nursery of the Abbey of Saint Markovia (chapter8, area S23).
low.text: Look to a place where sickness and madness are bred. Where children once cried, the treasure lies still.

low.name: Trader
low.secretText: The treasure lies in the glassblower's workshop in the Wizard of Wines (chapter 12, area W10).
low.text: Look to the wizard of wines! In wood and sand the treasure hides.

low.name: Merchant
low.secretText: The treasure lies in Castle Ravenloft's wine cellar (chapter 4, area K63).
low.text: Seek a cask that once contained the finest wine, of which not a drop remains.

low.name: Guild Member
low.secretText: The treasure lies in the crypt of Artank Swilovich (chapter 4, area K84, crypt 5).
low.text: I see a room full of bottles. It is the tomb of a guild member.

low.name: Beggar
low.secretText: The treasure is hidden in Kasimir's hovel (chapter 5, area N9a).
low.text: A wounded elf has what you seek. He will part with the treasure to see his dark dreams fulfilled.

low.name: Thief
low.secretText: The treasure is buried in the graveyard at the River Ivlis crossroads (chapter 2, area F).
low.text: What you seek lies at the crossroads of life and death, among the buried dead.

low.name: Tax Collector
low.secretText: The treasure is hidden in the Vistani treasure wagon (chapter 5, area N9i). "A missing child" refers to Arabelle (see chapter 2, area L).
low.text: The Vistani have what you seek. A missing child holds the key to the treasure's release.

low.name: Miser
low.secretText: The treasure lies in Castle Ravenloft's treasury (chapter 4, area K41).
low.text: Look for a fortress inside a fortress, in a place hidden behind fire.

low.name: Rogue
low.secretText: The treasure is hidden in the attic of the Blue Water Inn (chapter 5, area N2q).
low.text: I see a nest of ravens. There you will find the prize.

low.name: Monk
low.secretText: The treasure lies in the main hall of the Abbey of Saint Markovia (chapter 8, area S13).
low.text: The treasure you seek is hidden behind the sun, in the house of a saint.

low.name: Missionary
low.secretText: The treasure is hidden inside on the scarecrows in the garden of the Abbey of Saint Markovia (chapter 8, area S9).
low.text: I see a garden dusted with snow, watched over by a scarecrow with a sackcloth grin. Look not to the garden but to the guardian.

low.name: Healer
low.secretText: The treasure lies beneath the gazebo in the Shrine of the White Sun (chapter 8, area S4).
low.text: Look to the west. Find a pool blessed by the light of the white sun.

low.name: Shepherd
low.secretText: The treasure lies in the tomb of King Barov and Queen Ravenovia (chapter 4, area K88).
low.text: Find the mother - she who gave birth to evil.

low.name: Druid
low.secretText: The treasure lies at the base of the Gulthias tree (chapter 14, area Y4). Any wereraven encountered in the wilderness can lead the characters to the location.
low.text: An evil tree grows atop a hill of graves where the ancient dead sleep. The ravens can help you find it. Look for the treasure there.

low.name: Anarchist
low.secretText: The treasure lies in Castle Ravenloft's hall of bones (chapter 4, area K67).
low.text: I see walls of bones, the chandelier of bones, and table of bones - all that remains of enemies long forgotten.

low.name: Charlatan
low.secretText: The treasure lies in the attic of Old Bonegrinder (chapter 6, areas O4).
low.text: I see a lonely mill on a precipice. The treasure lies within.

low.name: Bishop
low.secretText: The treasure lies in the sealed treasury of the Amber Temple (chapter 13, area X40).
low.text: What you seek lies in a pile of treasure beyond a set of amber doors.

low.name: Traitor
low.secretText: The treasure is hidden in the master bedroom of the Wachterhaus (chapter 5, area N4o).
low.text: Look for a wealthy woman. A staunch ally of the devil, she keeps the treasure under lock and key, with the bones of an ancient enemy.

low.name: Priest
low.secretText: The treasure lies in Castle Ravenloft's chapel (chapter 4, area K15).
low.text: You will find what you seek in the castle, amid the ruins of a place of supplication

low.name: Transmuter
low.secretText: The treasure lies in Castle Ravenloft's north tower peak (chapter 4, area K60).
low.text: Go to a place of dizzying heights, where the stone itself is alive!

low.name: Diviner
low.secretText: The treasure lies in Madam Eva's encampment (chapter 2, area G). If she is the one performing the card reading, she says, "I think the treasure is under my very nose!"
low.text: Look to the one who sees all. The treasure is hidden in her camp.

low.name: Enchanter
low.secretText: The treasure lies under Marina's monument in Berez (chapter 10, area U5). "The master of the marsh" refers to Burgomaster Lazlo Ulrich (area U2), whose ghost can point the characters toward the monument.
low.text: I see a kneeling woman - a rose of great beauty plucked too soon. The master of the marsh knows of whom I speak.

low.name: Abjurer
low.secretText: The treasure lies in the beacon of Argynvostholt (chapter 7, area Q53). "Great stone dragon" refers to the statue in area Q1.
low.text: I see a fallen house guarded by a great stone dragon. Look to the highest peak.

low.name: Elementalist
low.secretText: The treasure is inside a model of Castle Ravenloft in the Amber Temple (chapter 13, area X20).
low.text: The treasure is hidden in a small castle beneath a mountain, guarded by amber giants.

low.name: Evoker
low.secretText: The treasure is hidden in the crypt of Gralmore Nimblenobs (chapter 4, area K84, crypt 37).
low.text: Search for the crypt of the wizard ordinaire. His staff is the key.

low.name: Illusionist
low.secretText: The treasure lies in Rictavio's carnival wagon (chapter 5, area N5).
low.text: A man is not what he seems. He comes here in a carnival wagon. Therein lies what you seek.

low.name: Necromancer
low.secretText: The treasure lies in Castle Ravenloft's study (chapter 4, area K37).
low.text: A woman hangs above a roaring fire. Find her and you will find the treasure.

low.name: Conjurer
low.secretText: The treasure is in Baba Lysaga's hut (chapter 10, area U3).
low.text: I see a dead village, drowned by a river, ruled by one who has brought great evil into the world.

low.name: Wizard
low.secretText: The treasure lies on the top floor of Van Richten's Tower (chapter 11, area V7).
low.text: Look for a wizard's tower on a lake. Let the wizard's name and servant guide you to that which you seek.

low.name: Avenger
low.secretText: The treasure is in the possession of Vladimir Horngaard in Argynvostholt (chapter 7, area Q36).
low.text: The treasure lies in a dragon's house, in hands once clean and now corrupted.

low.name: Paladin
low.secretText: The treasure lies in Sergei's tomb (chapter 4, area K85).
low.text: I see a sleeping prince, a servant of the light and the brother of darkness. The treasure lies with him.

low.name: Soldier
low.secretText: The treasure lies on the rooftop of the Tsolenka Pass guard tower (chapter 9, area T6).
low.text: Go to the mountains. Climb the white tower guarded by golden knights.

low.name: Mercenary
low.secretText: The treasure lies in a crypt in Castle Ravenloft (chapter 4, area K84, crypt 31).
low.text: The thing you seek lies with the dead, under mountains of gold coins.

low.name: Myrmidon
low.secretText: The treasure lies in the shrine of the Mother Night in the werewolf den (chapter 15, area Z7).
low.text: Look for a den of wolves in the hills overlooking a mountain lake. The treasure belongs to Mother Night.

low.name: Berserker
low.secretText: The treasure lies in the crypt of General Kroval "Mad Dog" Grislek (chapter 4, area K84, crypt 38).
low.text: Find the Mad Dog's crypt. The treasure lies within, beneath the blackened bones.

low.name: Hooded One
low.secretText: The treasure inside the head of a giant statue in the Amber Temple (chapter 13, area X5a).
low.text: I see a faceless god. He awaits you at the end of a long and winding road, deep in the mountains.

low.name: Dictator
low.secretText: The treasure lies in Castle Ravenloft's audience hall (chapter 4, area K25).
low.text: I see a throne fit for a king.

low.name: Torturer
low.secretText: The treasure is in the attic of the burgomaster's mansion in Vallaki (chapter 5, area N3s).
low.text: There is a town where all is not well. There you will find a house of corruption, and within, a dark room full of still ghosts.

low.name: Warrior
low.secretText: The treasure lies in Strahd's tomb (chapter 4, area K86).
low.text: That which you seek lies in the womb of darkness, the devil's "lair": the one place to which he must return.

spread.name: Tome of Strahd
spread.secretText: This card tells of history. Knowledge of the ancient will help you better understand your enemy.

spread.name: Holy Symbol of Ravenkind
spread.secretText: This card tells of a powerful force for good and protection, a holy symbol of great hope.

spread.name: Sunsword
spread.secretText: This is a card of power and strength. It tells of a weapon of vengeance: a sword of sunlight.

spread.name: Strahd's Enemy
spread.secretText: This card sheds light on one who will help you greatly in the battle against darkness.

spread.name: Strahd
spread.secretText: Your enemy is a creature of darkness, whose powers are beyond mortality. This card will lead you to him!
